sectionTitle: Real-World Factors Favoring a Low Dividend Payout

columns.text: This exercise requires us to determine the tax benefits of low dividends and the reason why floatation costs favor a low payout.

## Requirement 17.3a

Generally, dividends have been taxed at the same rates as ordinary income. When dividends are low, dividend tax rates are reduced, giving a company a much larger tax incentive to pay dividends.

## Requirement 17.3b 

**Flotation Cost** are costs a company incurs when it issues a new stock.

Low payouts are less expensive than the high payouts. Flotation expenses favor low payouts over high payouts since higher payouts must sell some stock to catch up and incur expensive flotation fees.
This exercise determines the  tax benefits for low dividends and the relationship of floatation cost to low payout.

### KEY TERMS

* **Dividends** - refers to the resources earned by the entity that is paid out to its shareholders. This may be in the form of cash, property, or stocks.
* **Taxes** - these are the contributions that are imposed on the income of an individual and business entities as well as the value added on the commodities.
* **Flotation Costs** - these are the costs paid by the entity who issues new shares on the public market. These are one of the reasons to consider in valuation of stocks, when the entity incurred an expensive flotation costs, the more expensive the price per stock will be.

### Requirement A

The tax benefit of a low dividend includes a low rate imposition of capital gains tax. Apart from the capital gains tax can be deferred until the corresponding securities are sold by the owner, the government also imposed a lower tax on low dividends unlike those securities that generate a higher dividend.

### Requirement B

Most of the firms favor a low payout dividends since there will be no necessary spendings on flotation cost in releasing new shares just to catch up with a rapidly changing market. Unlike the entities with high paying dividends that need to regularly offer new stocks just to adhere with the market, this will lead to more spendings on flotation cost.

Although these securities only generates low dividends, embedded with it are the tax savings and cost savings that will be incurred when an individual opt to choose high paying dividends for them to invest on.
